Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <elvinsophus> Has anyone tested the script in FAQ3 in #faq-chosen channel? I think it calculates the days to maturity incorrectly by unnecessarily subtracting current block height from blockstomaturity. I'm on a Windows machine and cannot test it myself at the moment.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> @elvinsophus The calculation is obviously wrong. I mentioned this in another channel when @TexWiller posted the same thing as a response, but I had no idea it was in the FAQ. Subtracting the current block creates a bad solve when blockstomaturity<=current block. There is also an assumption that the blocks/day is always exactly 1440, which is not true and therefore the dates are not "exact". They are "estimated".@crypto05  This needs to be updated.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> i believe @crypto05 fixed that a while ago

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> is there another place?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> @miketout the incorrect info is in #faq-chosen and I add changes to #faq-edited .  @TexWiller has also been continuing to provide this response to people who ask even though it is incorrect. I do not see that it is fixed anywhere.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @bigtom i see what you're referring to now. thank you 😃 !

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <crypto05> @bigtom thank you, I posted your edits to the faq-chosen as well. Please DM me your receiving address for the editing bounty.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> @patcrypto Each block is randomly time released for maturity. I believe the max is about 2 years. I have some that are a few months to a year until mature. When the next halving in the reward goes into effect (96 VRSC/block), there will no longer be a wait time on those. The maturity is only for the early 384 and 192 reward blocks.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <patcrypto> Thanks ... I have 3 of the 192 blocks and it seems they are now harder to mine as more people must be mining.   that's a hell of a long wait though

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> @patcrypto When you look at your reward blocks in wallet you will see a a blockstomaturity number. if you divide that number by 1440 you will get the approximate number of days when it will be unlocked.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <bigtom> #general-discussion  Why is everyone mining VRSC? Plenty of new crypto currencies out there. 
I like VRSC because of the general vision and the people behind it are notable individuals with real world experience. The decentralization effort is of very unique interest. If there was a coin that seems to be on par with security and practice like the current mainstream coins, it is VRSC.

It is not just a coin. It is a great move for blockchain transactions in general.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @bigtom thank you for your comments. i look forward to your continued analysis and thoughts as we progress.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <original_username> @bigtom 

I am mining for the idealism first and foremost. I like the vision paper a lot, even if it is a bit cheesy at times (reminds me of the first few episodes of Silicon Valley). I do like cheesy though really ;)

Secondly I am mining for the tech, there is a great blend of some of the strongest pieces of crypto development so far here. The clincher was the CPU mining, which makes mining accessible and realistic for those of us who don't want to buy a ton/have a ton of GPUs ready to go. I had one PC, then I bought a Ryzen 2700 just to mine this coin. CPU mining plus POS also makes mining more democratic, and probably less resource intensive, and with the algo developments from 0.3.8 onwards, should allow for relatively sustainable decentralisation. 

Other points are that the vision paper not only has ideas for "making the world a better place" through decentralised voting system and free/open information sharing etc, it also has ideas to gain mass appeal - such as phone apps for voting on your favourite pets. Make that accessible enough and mass appeal is a real possibility. 

Lasty but importantly, after I did a little reading through Mike's CV. I have to say I couldn't be happier that such a great project is being led by such an accomplished individual and supported by his network. The progressive work done with the CPU algo just goes to show what is possible.
